questions.question:
What is the main clause in this sentence?
 Even though John likes jam, he hates marmalade.

What is the subordinate (or dependent) clause in this sentence?
 The wax is melting because it is too hot.

Identify the type of clause:
 The students needed to complete their maths homework

Identify the type of clause:
 The players were thrilled

Identify the type of clause:
 After we finished cleaning our room

Identify the type of clause:
 Since we moved here from Chile, we have met many people.

Identify the type of clause:
 If the trip is cancelled, we can play tennis.

Identify the type of clause:
 Was the movie that the reviewers liked sold out?

What part of the following sentence is an INDEPENDENT CLAUSE, also known as the main clause?
 Until you eat your supper, there will be no dessert for you!
choice: there will be no dessert for you

questions.question:
What is the subordinating clause in the sentence below?
 While the children slept, their parents decorated for the party.
choice: their parents decorated for the party
